EU_DSA.title: EU Digital Services Act
EU_DSA.summary: Platforms must offer user-friendly illegal-content reporting, act on notices promptly, maintain notice/action logs, publish transparency reports, and explain how recommender systems and ads work—especially around risks to minors.

EU_GDPR.title: EU General Data Protection Regulation
EU_GDPR.summary: Require a lawful basis, clear privacy notices, user rights (access/delete/rectify), and strong security. High-risk features like profiling need a Data Protection Impact Assessment.

US_COPPA.title: Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act
US_COPPA.summary: Obtain verifiable parental consent before collecting, using, or disclosing personal data from children under 13; provide clear privacy notices; minimize data; and maintain reasonable security.

US_NCMEC_REPORTING.title: NCMEC Reporting (CSAM)
US_NCMEC_REPORTING.summary: Online services must report apparent CSAM they become aware of to NCMEC without delay and preserve relevant data for law enforcement.

US_CA_AADC.title: California Age-Appropriate Design Code (guidance-focused)
US_CA_AADC.summary: High-privacy defaults for minors, DPIAs for youth-facing features, limits on profiling/geolocation, and avoidance of dark patterns that nudge children to share more data.

US_FL_MINOR_ONLINE_SAFETY.title: Florida Minor Online Safety Requirements
US_FL_MINOR_ONLINE_SAFETY.summary: Age verification, parental consent for younger users, and restrictions on addictive/harmful features for minors, including limiting night-time notifications.

US_UT_SOCIAL_MEDIA.title: Utah Social Media Requirements for Minors
US_UT_SOCIAL_MEDIA.summary: Verify age; obtain parental consent for minors; provide parental controls and access; set night-time curfews/notification limits; and enable the most protective defaults for minors.
